oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rick Riman tapes - tape 1 of 5 - Side one - Channel one
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bluegrass performances collected by Rick Riman. On loan from Craig S. Wales. Includes session takes and live personal appearance recordings. Country Boys; Billy Ray (banjo) - Clarence White (guitar) - Roland White ? (mandolin) - Leroy Mack (dobro) - Roger Bush (bass) - Bob Sloan ? (fiddle). Appearing with Bill and Charlie Monroe is Bobby Hicks and Vassar Clements on fiddle. Bill Monroe's Bluegrass Boys at Oak Leaf Park listed as Bobby Smith - Tony Ellison - Billy Baker - Bessie Lee Mauldin - others. Audio restricted. Contact for access.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:date: 19yy-mm-dd; any listed date information is in the content fields.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Country Boys (Clarence White, Billy Ray Latham, Roger Bush, Scott Hambley, Leroy McNees); Bill and Charlie Monroe; Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys; Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys; Carter Stanley; Mac Wiseman; Jim and Jesse and the Virginia Boys;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Country Boys P. R. #78 -- (00:00) Howdy Hoss (Country Boys) / (02:58) High On A Mountain / (05:25) In The Valley Below / (08:36) Memphis Special (announced as take 4) / (11:07) Singin' All Day And Dinner On The Ground (announced as take 8) / (14:01) Turkey In The Straw (Bill and Charlie Monroe live at Town Hall Party 12-24 and 12-25 of 1954 or 1955) / (16:05) Footprints In The Snow / (19:06) Blue Moon Of Kentucky / (21:42) Cheyenne / (24:24) Comments from host Jay Stewart / (25:17) Christmas Time's A'Coming / (28:04) In The Pines - excerpt (Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys live at Ash Grove circa Fall of 1961) / (30:36) Mountain Dew (Country Boys) / (32:53) Rolling In My Sweet Baby's Arms (Country Boys live at Ash Grove in April 1962) / (35:01) Introductions / (36:14) Pike County Breakdown / (39:16) Way Downtown / (42:29) Footprints In The Snow / (45:17) Old Rattler / (48:17) Rocky Run (Instrumental) / (50:59) Precious Memories / (53:36) Rawhide (Instrumental) /

(57:07) Mad Banjo (Country Boys circa Fall of 1961) / (59:24) Loving You Too Well / (01:02:07) I'm A Pilgrim / (01:04:54) Linda Lou (Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys live at Oak Leaf Park from July 4, 1961 after comments about some bluegrass people not wanting to be on the show with him) / (01:07:36) Sugar Coated Love (Monroe with Carter Stanley after comments about Flatt and Scruggs not being in attendance) / (01:12:28) What Would You Give In Exchange For Your Soul? (Bill Monroe with Carter Stanley) / (01:15:46) Can't You Hear Me Calling (Bill Monroe with Mac Wiseman) / (01:18:54) Traveling Down This Lonesome Road (Bill Monroe with Mac Wiseman) / (01:22:04) Whitehouse Blues / (01:24:19) Y'all Come / (01:26:18) Air Mail Special (Jim and Jesse and the Virginia Boys live at Oak Leaf Park on July 4, 1961) / (01:27:15) Pardon Me / (01:29:33) Lady Of Spain / (01:31:40) Comedy skit / (01:33:53) Too Old To Cut The Mustard / (01:35:25) Long break in recording /
